Welcome Mallory! You are now about to intercept the connection between Alice and Bob

Alice and Bob are using Diffie Hellman key exchange algorithm to establish a shared key
The shared key is then used as the key for AES CBC for encryption

Decrypt the message sent by them to obtain the flag!

# INITIAL
Alice: {"g": 6543095361894918217005765624678157584074391665091096908046426839073252336355243659923878052368615504723460867702806518401164016666402441001319649625671211, "n": 9271597072752473092330283351560290893343579995187855633116608902491074731952286151770472446448565453085251773232626744072611958598442730946568954980761991, "pub": 51798604927076998616329954780924114692846820538386970110880941303103978337247773743157054615473692228578830011701632480898066831322106186384758807716550}

{"iv": "e0c3861084a24ea8fa4f04a91fec1fe5", "ciphertext": "e6ed4f2726c3854b399ab8a8b11377eaa3b7f2a08619a2cda4f56af0e3720c7b"}

Algorithm: G, generator, P, prime, announced publicly.
Alice chooses a, s.t. Apub = G^a % P
Bob chooses b s.t. Bpub = G^b % P

mutual key S = ((G^a % P) ^ b % P)
